channel.title: Idea Help!
channel.description: So I have this balde started i want to know what you guys think about the idea and maybe what needs to be changed. Thanks [img]https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-dqgw5CM33r8/UXWEgtfy2MI/AAAAAAAAARE/n1K42wLJ9hg/s640/Swirl.bmp[/img]

item.title: Idea Help!
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:13, topic:517735”]Ok, time I posted constructively for once.

You can go a lot of different ways with this progress, you can either continue with it as a sword as Amy showed us, or perhaps make it differently. You can easily make it an earth-based wand, for example. Since you originally planned it as a sword, you can make a hilt that almost fuses with the blade, keeping the same artistic style (such as making the handle wrap around the user’s arm). If I were home I’d try to draw what I mean, but sadly I’m only on my phone. I’m sure whichever way you go, the finished product will come out great.[/quote]

i know you meant this for him, but i like that idea of making it come up from the hand and wrap around the players arm im definitely gunna use this idea in my project! thanks even though you were trying to help him lol. of course ima make my own type of model though with this idea of wrapping around the players arm.

Read full topic

item.title: Idea Help!
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Ok, time I posted constructively for once.

You can go a lot of different ways with this progress, you can either continue with it as a sword as Amy showed us, or perhaps make it differently. You can easily make it an earth-based wand, for example. Since you originally planned it as a sword, you can make a hilt that almost fuses with the blade, keeping the same artistic style (such as making the handle wrap around the user’s arm). If I were home I’d try to draw what I mean, but sadly I’m only on my phone. I’m sure whichever way you go, the finished product will come out great.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:11, topic:517735”]I had some spare time, and it didn’t take me that long.[/quote]needs like electric sparks or something coming off of it

can call it the als for amy longsword

item.title: Idea Help!
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:9, topic:517735”]I would probably add a dilated type of crescent hand guard, maybe wavy, with a basic hilt and a follow up of the blade down from the hand grip. If that didn’t work out i’d most likely experiment with things close to that, maybe change the design completely and integrate the hand grip into the blade and go from there.

Like this.

[/quote]

amy did you really go out of the way just to remake his design and add a hilt lol… your crazy. does look nice though

Read full topic

item.title: Idea Help!
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

I would probably add a dilated type of crescent hand guard, maybe wavy, with a basic hilt and a follow up of the blade down from the hand grip. If that didn’t work out i’d most likely experiment with things close to that, maybe change the design completely and integrate the hand grip into the blade and go from there.

Like this.

Read full topic

item.title: Idea Help!
item.dc:creator: @allinall allinall
item.description:
@allinall wrote:

hadlich4:

i like it looks good and i also agree with poopler twist of fate sounds nice, ive noticed you like to do a lot of abstract type of work and you like to use bright colors its unique are you doing any projects at the moment?

No I am not working on any projects just some models here and there. also Thanks for the feedback
